summary: Isaac Bashevis Singer  was a leading writer in Yiddish literature.
full_text: Isaac Bashevis Singer  was a Polish-born Jewish author in Yiddish, awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1978. The Polish form of his birth name was Icek Hersz Zynger. He used his mother's first name in an initial literary pseudonym, Izaak Baszewis, which he later expanded to the form under which he is now known. He was a leading figure in the Yiddish literary movement, writing and publishing only in Yiddish. He also was awarded two U.S. National Book Awards, one in Children's Literature for his memoir A Day Of Pleasure: Stories of a Boy Growing Up in Warsaw  and one in Fiction for his collection, A Crown of Feathers and Other Stories .
title: Isaac Bashevis Singer
